summary: Publishing Layer feature testing complete. All 17 backend API tests passed (100%). Frontend UI testing verified all components: Publishing Dashboard with stats cards, filters, and task table; Settings Publishing tab with platform connection cards and connect/disconnect functionality; SubmissionDetailPage Publishing panel with Post Now/Schedule/Cancel buttons.
passed_tests: GET /api/platform-connections - returns all 3 platforms with connection status
POST /api/platform-connections/{platform}/connect - mock OAuth connect works for all platforms
POST /api/platform-connections/{platform}/disconnect - disconnect platform works
POST /api/publishing-tasks - create publishing task with validation
GET /api/publishing-tasks - list tasks with optional filters (platform, status)
PATCH /api/publishing-tasks/{id} - update task status/scheduledAt
DELETE /api/publishing-tasks/{id} - delete task (prevents deleting posted tasks)
POST /api/publishing-tasks/{id}/post-now - immediate mock post
POST /api/publishing-tasks/create-and-post - convenience endpoint
GET /api/publishing-stats - returns posted, scheduled, failed, draft counts
Unauthorized access correctly rejected (401)
Invalid platform validation (422)
Task creation fails for disconnected platform (400)
Task creation fails for non-existent submission (404)
Publishing Dashboard shows stats cards (Posted: 1, Scheduled: 1, Failed: 0, Total: 2)
Publishing Dashboard shows filters (Platform, Status) and task table
Settings Publishing tab shows all 3 platform connection cards
Settings Publishing tab shows Connected status with account handles
Settings Publishing tab has Disconnect buttons for connected platforms
SubmissionDetailPage Publishing panel shows all 3 platforms
SubmissionDetailPage shows Posted/Live status for YouTube Shorts
SubmissionDetailPage shows Scheduled status with date for Instagram Reels
SubmissionDetailPage shows Post Now/Schedule buttons for TikTok
SubmissionDetailPage shows Cancel button for scheduled tasks
Sidebar has Publishing link in navigation

APScheduler background job runs every 30 seconds to process scheduled tasks
